Body: I have a DHT22 sensor reading temperature and humidity on raspberry pi. I have installed Mosquitto on my raspberry pi as well as my laptop(windows). All i need is python code to publish real time sensor data over mosquitto. (i have an account on opensensors where i have created topics to which the data must be published)

Welcome to stackoverflow. The idea of asking questions here is that you have a specific problem you need some help with. You should have searched far and wide for an answer, have tried many possible solutions and detail what you have tried. If you've done all that, then and only then if you still cannot find an answer to your problem do you admit defeat and submit to the shame of asking a question. I've done nothing
column9: please write my program for me" is not what stackoverflow is about."

Body: Welcome to stackoverflow. If you don't feel like answering a question please don't. Kindly suggest me on how I could try. Making someone feel ashamed of themselves for asking a question is not what stackoverflow is about.
Roger's point is that the links I've supplied are the first 2 hits on google with the most basic of search terms
Well nothing. I've only published single data items using command lines e.g. mosquitto_pub in the terminal. But I need a way to publish from within python script.

Adafruit have a python library that will read from the DT22:

https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit-Raspberry-Pi-Python-Code/blob/master/Adafruit_DHT_Driver_Python/Adafruit_DHT.py

There are plenty of Python MQTT examples out there but this should be a good start:

https://eclipse.org/paho/clients/python/

Try sticking those together and post a new question if you get stuck

"
Thanks!! I'll try that and let you know how it goes!
